results.title: Mining in Action
results.creator_credit: Harold Dews, Cinesound Movietone and Conzinc Riotinto of Australia
results.brief_description: Surveys the development of mining operations of Hammersley Iron and Bougainville copper, the lead/zinc operation of the company and the opening of the aluminium smelter at Bluff, New Zealand.

results.title: Wyperfeld
results.brief_description: Wyperfeld National Park in North-western Victoria: its birds, animals, wildflowers and trees. The Ranger travels through the sand dunes of the Mallee country, stopping at a bore to pump water. Birds gather to drink - galahs, crested pigeons, ringneck parrots, honeyeaters, ravens and white cockatoos. Kangaroos, emus and the bushy-tailed possum abound amongst stands of red gums and Murray pine, and wildflowers seen include the white ever-lasting and Austral beauties. Bird watchers visiting the park study the beautiful Mallee fowl. Camera, editing and script: David Corke. Music: George Dreyfus Assistance and location recording: Peter Bruce. Park Ranger: Alec Campbell.

results.title: Trespass on Summerland
results.creator_credit: Brighton Grammar School (Vic.). Film Makers Club
results.brief_description: A few boys enjoying a camping holiday are evicted from their camp by an irate farmer. They later save his son trapped on a precipitous cliff face. (Awards: 2nd prize at the International Contest for Young Film Makers, Milan, Italy)

results.title: Stamina
results.brief_description: A film illustrating the manufacture of Stamina trousers and showing the care exercised in all stages. The various processes are shown together with a brief history of men’s dress and the sewing machine.

results.title: Passing Era of the Steam Horse
results.brief_description: Steam locomotives have been replaced by diesels on the Victorian Railways. Their history in the system is briefly covered, and various types are shown in operation, concluding with the narrow gauge service from Ferntree Gully to Gembrook being restored as a tourist feature.
results.description: Steam locomotives have been replaced by diesels on the Victorian Railways. Their history in the system is briefly covered, and various types are shown in operation, concluding with the narrow gauge service from Ferntree Gully to Gembrook being restored as a tourist feature.

results.title: Our friends, why?
results.creator_credit: J. Biss, R. Dudfield and Brighton Grammar School (Vic.). Film Makers Club
results.brief_description: The story revolves around two brothers, their friends and a broken kite. When the friends find out they have been hoaxed by the brothers, there is a rumpus, but finally all shake hands and are friends again. (Award: Best film of all categories at the 1963 Milan International Festival for Young Film Makers)

results.title: Creative Activity: Our First Puppet Play
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

video_links.name: Creative Activity: Our First Puppet Play

results.brief_description: A classroom film describing the steps in the production of a puppet play by primary school children. Shows the various stages in production: planning of story and action; choosing puppets; making props and backdrop; preparing stage; allotting parts; rehearsing; finally, the finished puppet show.

results.title: Life is More Pleasant with Wine
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the joys of drinking wine, a harmonious accompaniment to many activities. Suggests times, places and accompaniments for wine; discusses the qualities and features of each type of wine, the type of glass required; and how best to serve it.
